analysis.Summary: SectionRoadmap.vue is a Vue 3 component that renders a horizontal, scrollable roadmap timeline. It displays a series of milestones with dates, titles, descriptions, and an optional checkmark icon for completed items, using vue-i18n for localized text.
analysis.Purpose: To provide a reusable, styled roadmap section on the landing page, showing project milestones in a visually consistent, internationalized format.

analysis.Usage: Imported into a parent or page component (e.g. LandingPage.vue) via `import SectionRoadmap from 'modules/landing/components/sections/SectionRoadmap.vue'` and then used in its template as `<SectionRoadmap :textData="..." />`. Props can override default roadmap data or provide translations for other locales.
Notes: Default `textData` provides only English content; additional locales must be merged via parent i18n setup or by passing a custom prop.
The `milestone.finished` flag is checked truthily (string 'true' counts as true), so better practice would be a Boolean.
Scoped SCSS hides scrollbars in Firefox, IE/Edge, Chrome, Safari while preserving scroll behavior.
Uses responsive `min-width` on `.timeline-item` to ensure horizontal scroll on smaller viewports.
